title.narrative: Fostering Resilience by Strengthening Abilities (FORSA)

description.narrative: The 'Fostering Resilience by Strengthening Abilities (FORSA), is a €4,500,000 integrated programme designed to reduce inter-communal tensions between Lebanese, Syrians and Palestinians by alleviating competition over livelihoods. FORSA will expand employment and economic opportunities for both individuals and businesses and improve the function of Public and Private TVET centres in Zahle, West Bekaa, Chouf, Jezzine and Saida. All of Lebanon’s major religious sects and political affiliations are represented in the target area, which includes or is bounded by three major metropolitan hubs and economic centres, including Saida, Zahle and Beirut. The overall objective of FORSA is to improve economic confidence and stability by creating equitable economic and employment opportunities for target communities in Lebanon. To do this FORSA will focus on addressing constraints to employment due to mismatched or missing labour skills, lack of social trust, political restrictions on employment, poor business management capacity and the poor capacity of vocational training institutions within the agriculture, manufacturing, services and energy sectors in Lebanon by: 1) Improving access to employment opportunities through market-led skills training courses; 2) Supporting micro and small business creation for vulnerable groups and graduated trainees through specialized training and technical assistance; 3) Building the technical capacity of both private and government-run vocational and professional training centres to provide sustainable high-quality training programmes.

recipient-country.narrative: All of Lebanon’s major religious sects and political affiliations are represented in the target area, which includes or is bounded by three major metropolitan hubs and economic centres, including Saida, Zahle and Beirut.

sector.narrative: Building the operational and technical capacity of both private and government-run vocational and professional training centres to provide sustainable, high-quality programmes.
Improving access to employment opportunities for vulnerable Lebanese and Syrian communities through market-led skills training courses
Supporting micro and small business creation for vulnerable groups through specialized training and technical assistance

humanitarian-scope.narrative: This project relates to the 3RP response plan.

policy-marker.narrative: Mercy Corps will undertake a Gender Assessment to clearly understand the constraints and perceptions on female employment by all stakeholders. Through our work with female and male community leaders Mercy Corps will help address those constraints, by providing appropriate gender responsive workforce and life skills training, linkages with women-led mentorship organisations, and fostering peer to peer interactions between individuals.

title.narrative: Indicator 1.3: No. of supported individuals demonstrating increased technical skills and knowledge

description.narrative: This indicator captures the total number of Skills component participants that demonstrate "Increased technical skills and knowledge", refering to an improved capacity related to the training subject matter (as demonstrated through pre- and post- tests tailored to each training). 1. Pre-training test (Skills) 2. Post-training test (Skills) Dissagregation: Age category (Youth, Adult) Sex Nationality Sector Area Means of verification: 1. Pre-training test (Skills) 2. Post-training test (Skills) Data collection: Pre- and post-course tests Frequency of data: On a rolling basis before and after technical courses Method of analysis: Qualitative individual assessment. Comparative analyses of pre and post test scores. Add all who show increase.

description.narrative: 1. Beneficiary pre-support survey (Skills) 2. Beneficiary post-support survey (Skills) 3. Employment Follow-Up Form (Skills)

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1: Total # of people who have become employed (Aggregate of employed/self employed from Outcome 1 - skills training Sub-Outcomes 1.1 and 1.2 [RA4.SG1 and RA4.SG.3)

description.narrative: Type of Indicator: Objective Situation Means of Verification: 1. Beneficiary pre-support survey (Skills) 2. Beneficiary post-support survey (Skills) Indicator Definition: A total number, not a percentage, trainees/ beneficiaries 3 to 6 months maximum after completion of the training programme who have become employed through programme support activities. New jobs created: individuals who have started their businesses, or businesses who have hired new employees for a minimum duration of three months since the support was provided – this includes individuals who work part-time or full-time, formally or informally. A full-time job is ongoing employment in which a person works a minimum number of hours defined as such by the Ministry of Labor/local government. Or his/her employer. Full-time employment varies by context. Part-time equivalent jobs created as a result of the program. Additional jobs minus jobs lost. A part-time job is ongoing employment where hours worked are less than full-time counterparts or less than normal for the context. Seasonal jobs created as a result of the program. A seasonal employment job is one in which workers are employed where the timing and duration of the contract is significantly influenced by seasonal factors such as the climatic cycle, public holidays and/or agricultural harvests. Seasonal work often refers to work in agriculture. (Seasonal employment could be part-time or full time and often wages are paid daily or weekly) Disaggregation: Age Sex Nationality Sector Type of employment Area Area: West Bekaa Center Bekaa Chouf Jezzine Saida Data Collection Method: 1. Employment endline survey Frequency of data collection: Baseline Midline Endline DONOR: annual reporting Responsible Person(s) & Team M&E Officers Field Officers Training providers Method of Analysis add all employed under skills omponent (full-time, part-time, seasonal) Responsible Person(s) M&E Manager Information Use Donor reports Frequency of Reporting Annual
